verbose_text: It has been hypothesized that intra-articular HA application causes analgesia by increasing the elastoviscosity of the intercellular matrix of soft tissues around the joint, thus providing a rheological buffer that reduces the force transmitted during joint movements to the transducing membrane elements at sensory nerve terminals innervating the synovial lining and capsule.
evidence: HA application causes analgesia by increasing the elastoviscosity of the intercellular matrix
